content.description: start under the roof and work out beautiful sandstone holds and slopers and top out
content.location: down the hill from mega-fauna boulder

content.description: rightward traverse that is pretty sustained. Start on a really awesome sloper, move right on  some crimps to a large deadpoint for a pocket. move up and right through some jugs to get established on the face.  Not much is gained by attempting the topout, which is tall and chossy.
content.location: 1st large boulder/detached cliff line coming out of the corridor.

content.description: start squatting with hands on a good rail. work up sloping rails, all pretty good, to a little slopey topout.
content.location: right side of warm up boulder

content.description: Start on the diagonal rail and work to some good edges out left and high. Finish at the break where the rock gets chossy.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Columbine, to the right of the hollow flake.

content.description: Awesome! start on the downhill side of the face on a flat jug, work up and left through the perfect sandstone jugs, get a left hand in the last and highest pocket and make a big move to the sloper horn up top. the top out is a bit awkard (go around the right and grab hidden right hand sidepulls)
content.location: just downhill and around a boulder from the warm up boulder.

content.description: middle-left side of warm up boulder. starts on obvious holds in a break and follows the little crack up and left to a weird but ok topout.
content.location: warm up boulder

content.description:
Stand start with crimps on right side of arete. Climb arete on iron oxide edges to an airy finish. Move right across jugs to top it. No protection at that point and a big rock may or may not be in your trajectory if you come off at the top.

 Don't climb if you're not solid in the grade. There is a tree and a rock pillar to sling up top for anchor. Climb over from adjacent boulder to get on. Jump over to get off.
content.location: Tall arête next to the "Super Classic" boulder.

content.description: Same start as Super Classic, but work out right to more slopers and small holds to gain the same topout
content.location: same boulder as Super Classic, downhill from Mega-Fauna

content.description: Compression bloc. sit start with the right hand hand-jammed in a slot on the left side of the boulder and slap up left, then right, then left, then right, or whatever you want to do. lots of fun.
content.location: problem is west facing (downhill facing). from deal or no deal, follow the trail of boulders leading downhill to the last one in close proximity on the right, the problem will be on the downhill side.

content.description: Not classic, but a good warm up. start near tree on low jugs, work up and right all the way across the boulder, moving up in the process, top out on the right side of the face (to the left of rail gun). infinite beta possibilities, grade based solely on pump.
content.location: on warm up boulder, far left next to tree.

content.description: problem with a ton of iron pocket features near the start. Start on good holds in a small cave, first couple of moves go through the sea of iron outcroppings. Choose the correct combo and win big! get to the jug, then just one long, sideways deadpoint to the sloping arête stands between you and victory.
content.location: across the gulley (north), and a little downhill of mega fauna boulder. can see the problem from mega fauna boulder

content.description:
interesting problem. some cool moves on a aesthetic arête, but hard to call a classic.   

  sit start on some very specific feet and hands up to a couple of slopey pockets to the right of the arête. move to the large rail on the left, use the small, terrible pinch on the arête a bit higher, and find a way to get to the jug.
content.location: on the boulder behind the mega fauna boulder, to the right. very pretty arête.

content.description: fun little problem and very cool features. sit start with some protruding features, slap up a few sloper moves using the holds on the left side of the arête, get established a little higher, and tiptoe your way right through the flakes to the topout of mega fauna. perfect little warm up.
content.location: sit start problem left of mega fauna's start, kind of on the arête of the boulder.

content.description: Start with hands on either side and make a move to a face hold. then start working up little edges aroud the sides and hug this refrigerator block for 15 feet then make a committing topout on slopers.  Definitely done before me, but I don't have any FA info.
content.location: first problem you see when approaching the north side, staying near the crag line

content.description: Beautiful over hung Saw-blade shaped arete with really interesting holds and body positions. One of the best problems of the grade in the state.
content.protection: This one is long, the more pads the better. I think we used 7 or 8 to cover the whole landing. You could definitely get by with less if you have a spotter drag pads.
content.location: Hike past the North area from and follow the Ozark Highlands trail. The trail literally goes underneath the boulder.

content.description: hard slabby dihedral with then crack. with your left foot on the left side and your right hand on the right side, get a little hop start to get your left hand up into the seam. do some funky stuff up to the drop off jug
content.location: to the right and around the corner from side scroller

content.description: fun climb climb with cool moves, but a bit contrived.  start way to the left of SNEKS and low on whatever hands you see fit (I used two underclings for the FA) and terrible feet. make a big move to the closest jug on SNEKS. Move up and right a bit to the highest set of jugs, then make a hard left hand move to a sloping sidepull (just down from the finishing sloper on SNEKS), set feet, make a quick grab for a jug on the right side of the sloper, and top out.
content.location: same boulder as SNEKS, down hill and around a boulder from the warm up boulder

content.description: Great little problem, just short.  start on the lowest good holds and work up and out the steepest part of the roof to a slopey but low ball topout.
content.location: same boulder as super classic, on the uphill side.

content.description: start on the right side of boulder in some breaky-funky jugs, work through the juggy shelf then straight up to top out.
content.location: A-Hole boulder, downhill and south of warm up and SNEKS boulders.

content.description: start low on a crappy flake, work up and right through a few holds in a small hueco, set and launch for the jug hole out right, work around and straight up through good holds to slopey, slightly dirty but easy topout.
content.location: down hill and a little north of warm up and SNEKS boulders

content.description: beautiful arête that has been laying in wait for an ascent.  Stand start at the obvious chest high break, step on and pick a left foot, work and slap up opposing holds until you gain the sideways jug and just cruise to the finish. basically a 10' v4 followed by 10' of v0-1 laybacking.  Once at the top, traverse right on flat jugs and good feet to the downclimb.
content.protection:
2-3 pads and a spotter.   

WARNING* while I did clean some choss off of the top, there might still be some loose holds. the big holds on the problem are good, but there are a few thinner jugs near the top that aren't necessary to use and may break if you do. just pay attention.
content.location: obvious arête along the trail near the warm up boulder. down the hill from sidescroller a bit. on the other side of the boulder that columbine is on.

content.description: Area Classic.  Cant miss this beautiful boulder. sit start on bad underclings and feet. throw left hand up to a shallow side-pull, then work through the compression moves with surprisingly specific feet to some jug flakes and a delicate, but easy topout.
content.protection: 2 pads should be fine, 3 is better
content.location: sit in the middle of a small gulley heading downhill. see map.

content.description:
sit start crossed on the left side of the boulder with the right hand low and the left on a perfectly ergonomic knob. move to the two obvious slopers, work your way to the obvious side-pull crimp on the face using a right undercling and some funk, then keep working your way right, topping out on the mega-fauna fins any way you can. The beta is extra weird and hard to solve, but an excellent problem when done.

 Nothing is "off" on this problem, though it is just a bit contrived. if you keep heading straight up the flakes, it becomes more difficult to get into the crimp. so while the upper flakes aren't "off" they are kind of a dead end if you want to do this problem.
content.location: left side of mega-fauna boulder

content.description: Awesome boulders, but a little spread out.  see maps for better beta.
